I'm guessing that must be Alphea, the Fairy school that Saladin had told me about.

There were so many books in here that you can accidentally mistake his office for a freaking library! I wasn't sure how many books that old geezer has collected over the years, but there was a fuckton of books.

As I walked through the office, I noticed a large portrait hanging on the right side of the room of a man wielding the exact same staff that Saladin was holding, as the old man made his way to his large desk. Putting two and two together, I figured that the guy in the portrait and Saladin were one and the same person, expecting that the guy in the painting must've been Saladin when he was at a younger age.

"You are correct, I happen to have a vast expertise on magic from my experience over the years. Anyway, onto a more serious matter at hand...." Saladin answered to me, as I noticed his left hand was raised and aimed at one of the bookshelves behind me, his hand glowing with some form of magical energy.

It wasn't until it passed by me that I realized what the old geezer was grabbing for; a black and purple book, with tan-gray colored pages. And judging from how thick the book was, there must be a lot information inside it, whatever that information may be. Then, I heard Saladin's voice once again as he said, "Tell me, Dalton; Have you ever heard of a mythical entity known as "The Grim Reaper"?"

Okay, that was new! Saladin asking me if I had heard of the Grim Reaper? Damn straight I know of him! I know that he's the Reaper of Souls, the Angel of Death, the Ghost of Christmas Yet-To-Come, one of the Four Horsemen of the goddamn Apocalypse, and the freaking personification of death and the afterlife! So in response to what he asked me, I scoffed at Saladin and his question and replied, "*scoff* Of course I've heard of the Grim Reaper, everybody on Earth has heard of this guy! I bet you 50 bucks that even Bloom's heard of the Grim Reaper, you crazy S.o.B."

Then again, why was Saladin asking me something as simple as seeing if I knew about the Grim Reaper? Something was off about this! So, I just cocked an eyebrow at the old wizard and asked, "Er, why are you asking me something like that?" "I think it's best that you see this for yourself, Dalton." Saladin answered to me, peeking over the opened book to look at me with a pair of serious eyes and furrowed brow.

From looking at that expression on his wrinkled face, I had a feeling that he was serious at this point. In response, I slowly walked around his large desk, putting down my scythe and leaning it against the side of his desk. Once I finally stood beside him, I got a good look at what the black and purple book's pages contained.

"Sweet mother of crap." I said under my own breath, looking at two of the book's pages, which contained large amounts of writing and a expertly good drawing of what appeared to be the one and only Grim Reaper himself! Hmm, interesting." Saladin said to me, rubbing his chin a bit, as I put the book's front cover back down on the desk.

It was weird, but that name...Nekross. I could feel it on the tip of my tongue, and yet, it didn't ring a bell in my mind. The name itself reminded me of the Latin word "Necro", which means "dead" in that old language. Fitting, I guess. Turning my head to look at the old man, I spoke to Saladin and asked, "So, what is Nekross, anyway? Isn't it the name of a planet or something like that?"

"Dalton, Nekross isn't just the name of a planet, it's also the same name of a civilization. The very same civilization that gave birth to the legend of the Grim Reaper. I couldn't see it, but I could hear Saladin's voice, asking me in worry if I was alright.

But moments later, I suddenly snapped back to reality, breathing heavily from the painful vision, feeling the increased beating pace in my heart, as it slowly decreased in pace bit by bit. So in response, I looked at him with my green and purple eyes and answered, "I...I'm not sure myself. Before all of this, I kept having these nightmares...of a city getting destroyed. They were looking for a powerful source of magic known as the "Dragon-Fire", which currently now resides in Bloom. What your...vision has shown you might not have been a look into the future, but rather, a memory that was repressed inside your mind. And judging from you told me, Dalton, you might have been born originally from the planet Nekross, but were brought to Earth for safety and refuge when you were just developing your memories."

I just couldn't believe what I was hearing with my own two ears; I might've been born on another planet! And from what Saladin had explained to me, it...it all makes sense now. So in response to what the old man had said to me, I looked at him and asked, "Alright, so I might be born on this Nekross planet. But...how do you explain these powers of mine, hmm?"

"Due to the overabundance of Nekross's planetary magic energy and the exposure to this source of energy, the Nekrons are naturally born with this source of magic in their blood. In other words, you are a natural born magical being." Saladin answered to me, finally giving me an explanation as to why I had these powers in the first place. I guess I was sort of born this way.

Looking at the palm of my left hand as this purple ethereal source of magic started flowing throughout my hand, circling around it like the Earth orbiting around the Sun, as I curled all the fingers on my left hand into a fist, speaking to Saladin and said, "So, what you're saying is that I was born with this sort of power, is that right?"

Nodding once, Saladin looked at me and replied, "Exactly, my confused young friend. Fortunately, Red Fountain also teaches boys who happen to exhibit signs of using magic, helping them learn in the ways of magic. However, we also happen to have some room to spare, if you choose to join our prestigious school, of course."

It was there that I saw two familiar faces; the same two guys I saw back when I was "branding" Icy with a nasty scar on that bitch's face, Sky, the "Prince" of Eraklyon, and.....well, I didn't know the other guy's name, but he had short dark brown hair and brown eyes.
